com.vijfhart.casus.tree

Class TreeComparator<T extends Node<T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.vijfhart.casus.tree.TreeComparator<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the node type
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Comparator<T>

    public class TreeComparator<T extends Node<T>>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Comparator<T>
    A comparator to specify the order of nodes in a tree. The comparator uses a local comparator to specify the order of siblings.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TreeComparator() 
      TreeComparator(java.util.Comparator<T> siblingComparator)

      • compare

        public int compare(T first,
                   T second)
        Specifies the ordering of nodes in a Tree. This is a recursive method: the ordering of nodes is known when: - one of the nodes has no parent (this should be the first node) - one node is the parent of the other (the parent should be placed first) - two nodes share the same parent (ordering is specified by the siblingComparator) If two nodes seem unrelated, the ordering is specified by ordering the parents.
        Specified by:
        compare in interface java.util.Comparator<T extends Node<T>>
        Parameters:
        first: - the first node to compare
        second: - the second node to compare
        Returns:
        -1 if the first node has a lowel level then the second node, +1 positive value if the first node has a higher level then the second node, 0 if the first node has the same level as the second node.
